pageTitle: Cisco IOS XR Advanced System Command Reference for the Cisco XR 12000 Router, Release 4.3.x - Troubleshooting Commands [Support] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {379=The commands in this chapter with the cisco-support task ID are used in the Cisco IOS XR Troubleshooting Guide for Cisco XR 12000 Series Router as part of the troubleshooting process. For information about commands with the cisco-support task ID that are not documented in this chapter, please contact Cisco Technical Support.}
textBeforeTable: Command History EXEC Command Modes No default behavior or values Command Default This command has no keywords or arguments. Syntax Description trace arp show To display Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) entries in the buffer, use the show arp trace command in EXEC mode. show arp trace watchdog threshold memory show uidb index show uidb trace show uidb data show tbm hardware show sysdb trace verification shared-plane show sysdb trace verification location show sysdb connections show netio trace show netio subblock show netio media-registrations show netio idb show netio db show netio clients show netio chains show imds interface brief show im database show cfgmgr trace show captured packets show arp trace These Cisco support commands are normally reserved for use by Cisco Technical
textAfterTable: Task ID Task ID Operations cisco-support read Examples The following example shows the output of the show arp trace command:  RP/0/0/CPU0:router# show arp trace events Tue Nov 10 04:13:22.766 PST 22 unique entries (4096 possible, 54 filtered) Nov 5 19:48:27.624 ipv4_arp/slow 0/RP0/CPU0 1# t1 ARP-EVENT: Repopulating AIB Nov 5 19:48:49.768 ipv4_arp/slow 0/RP0/CPU0 1# t1 ARP-DEV-EVENT: Unbinding frs Nov 5 19:49:01.590 ipv4_arp/slow 0/RP0/CPU0 1# t1 ARP-EVENT: IM ORE received Nov 5 19:54:12.448 ipv4_arp/slow 0/RP0/CPU0 5# t1 ARP-EVENT: Processing MAC c3 Nov 5 19:54:12.467 ipv4_arp/slow 0/RP0/CPU0 5# t1 ARP-EVENT: Interface attrib2 Nov 5 19:54:12.555 ipv4_arp/fast 0/RP0/CPU0 10# t1 ARP-EVENT: received interf3 Nov 5 19:54:12.595 ipv4_arp/fast 0/RP0/CPU0 5# t1 ARP-EVENT: Copying MAC addr3 Nov 5 19:54:12.614 ipv4_arp/fast 0/RP0/CPU0 6# t1 ARP-EVENT: Received VLAN ID) Nov 5 19:54:12.614 ipv4_arp/fast 0/RP0/CPU0 3# t1 ARP-EVENT: Processing VLAN ) Nov 5 19:54:15.434 ipv4_arp/slow 0/RP0/CPU0 5# t1 ARP-EVENT: Interface not up0 Nov 5 19:54:15.437 ipv4_arp/slow 0/RP0/CPU0 1# t3 ARP-EVENT: IMP caps add suc0 Nov 5 19:54:15.581 ipv4_arp/fast 0/RP0/CPU0 5# t1 ARP-EVENT: Completing IDB i0 Nov 5 19:54:15.673 ipv4_arp/slow 0/RP0/CPU0 1# t1 ARP-EVENT: interface_entry 0 Nov 5 19:54:15.793 ipv4_arp/pkt 0/RP0/CPU0
